plants.name: Rosa chinensis
plants.description: A species of rose native to Southwest China, widely cultivated and appreciated for its continuous blooming habit and variety of colors.
plants.bloomingSeason: Year-round in warm climates; especially prolific from spring to late fall
plants.location: Cultivated worldwide, native to China, blooms year-round in subtropical to tropical regions
plants.funFact: The China Rose was key in developing many modern rose cultivars and is one of the few roses that bloom continuously throughout the year in frost-free areas.

plants.name: Lupinus perennis
plants.description: A wildflower native to Eastern North America, known for its tall spikes of pea-like flowers and its role as a food source for the endangered Karner blue butterfly.
plants.bloomingSeason: Late spring to early summer, typically May to June
plants.location: Eastern USA and Canada, blooming naturally in dry, sandy soils
plants.funFact: Wild Lupine enriches the soil by fixing nitrogen and supports rare butterfly species.

plants.name: Hibiscus rosa-sinensis
plants.description: A tropical shrub with large, showy flowers that bloom throughout the year in tropical and subtropical regions, symbolizing delicate beauty.
plants.bloomingSeason: Year-round in tropical climates; especially abundant in spring and summer
plants.location: Tropical and subtropical regions worldwide; native to East Asia
plants.funFact: The hibiscus flower is the national flower of several countries, including Malaysia and South Korea.

plants.name: Anemone coronaria
plants.description: A perennial wildflower with distinctive cup-shaped flowers, native to the Mediterranean region, blooming in late spring to early summer.
plants.location: Mediterranean basin, often found in fields and rocky soils
plants.funFact: These flowers inspired the red poppy symbol for remembrance but belong to a different genus.
